editorialSummary.text: Contemporary business hotel with 2 restaurants & 2 bars, plus a spa, an outdoor pool & event space.

text.text:
My experience at Hilton Jaipur was absolutely delightful. Right from the time I walked in, I was treated with courtesy and professionalism. The lobby is so elegant and friendly looking, it immediately relaxes you.

The rooms were well-spacious, neat, and tidy, and all the minute details were well taken care of. The housekeeping staff did a great job in providing comfort and hygiene.

What truly impressed me was the hospitality of the staff. Every encounter whether it was from the front desk staff to restaurant service was friendly, attentive, and made me feel truly cared for. They were always willing to assist with a smile.

The cuisine was also a highlight. The spread during the buffet featured a range of dishes, both international and local, and every meal was fresh and delicious. Watching the sunset view from the rooftop in the evening is not to be missed , it provides an added special touch to the experience.

Overall, Hilton Jaipur provides the ideal combination of luxury, comfort, and hospitality. It's not so much a hotel, but a home away from home. I would highly recommend it to any visitor to Jaipur, business or pleasure.

text.text:
We recently enjoyed a two night stay at the Jaipur Hilton. Great room, extremely comfortable beds and friendly, helpful staff. We enjoyable the buffet restaurant for both breakfast and dinner and thought it had an excellent wide selection of dishes. The staff were also very helpful in showing us how to combine the different Indian dishes.
We also used the rooftop bar and swimming pool due to the hot steamy weather. A really lovely place to stay.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying a night at Hilton Resort Jaipur, and it was truly a delightful experience. The property beautifully blends modern comfort with Rajasthani elegance, offering a perfect getaway within the city. The check-in process was smooth, and the staff was extremely courteous, always ready to assist with a warm smile.
The room was spacious, well-maintained, and offered a great view, making the stay very comfortable. The resort amenities, including the pool and spa, added to the relaxation. Dinner at the restaurant was exceptional, with a wide variety of dishes and authentic flavors. The breakfast spread was equally impressive, offering both Indian and continental options.
What stood out the most was the hospitality – every staff member made sure the stay felt special. Even though it was just for a night, the experience was memorable and refreshing.
Highly recommend Hilton Resort Jaipur for anyone looking for a luxurious and peaceful stay in the Pink City.

text.text: We had the good fortune to spend three wonderful days at the Jaipur Inn, where the Bhargava family warmly received us and told us mesmerizing stories of the Inn and it's myriad of guests and visitors. We loved the ambience, the calm and charismatic cafe adorned with its treasure trove of messages, memories and trinkets. Watching a herd of peacocks frollicking about our balcony was a highlight of our stay. Elated to have spent our time at the Inn basking in its history and charm, instead of a commercial cookie-cutter hotel.

text.text:
My stay at Jaipur Inn was one of the most memorable experiences I've had during my solo travels. The space was inviting, and the family that runs it was incredibly warm, helpful, friendly, and generous. I was around for almost two weeks and stayed in the lovely Treetop Room which was spacious, clean, and tucked away in just the right corner of the property.

I was so glad to have chosen this place because it felt a lot less like a hotel and a lot more like staying with extended family. The food was simple, healthy and homely. The owner, Mr. Pushpendra, offered to take the guests on the most interesting, fun and offbeat morning walks which always ended with a belly full of some of Jaipur’s best breakfast foods.

During one of the morning walks, I even found myself at Govind Dev Ji's temple (which I probably wouldn't have visited otherwise, not being a particularly religious person), and ended up really enjoying the experience. On these walks, I also explored Smriti Van, Amber Fort, a couple of other temples, and wandered through the fascinating 'rastas' of old Jaipur in search of kachoris, dhoklas, barfis - and basically, all things great.

Jaipur Inn isn’t just a place to stay- it’s a way to experience Jaipur. You’ll see the city through the eyes of those who truly adore it. If you’re looking for an authentic, heartwarming, and joy-filled experience, this is that place. I went looking for a room, and found a second home and I am so grateful for it!

text.text:
Exceptionally bad service! Any requests made to guest services took about an hour and was done after 2-3 reminders. Service at the all day dining is unbelievably slow! Food is average. In room dining orders took close to an hour. We had to cancel an order of kulcha as it took more than 40 mins to be sent and by then the food was cold!
I truly have never seen a 5 star hotel with such bad service.

The duty manager at the time of check in, Angad, is someone who effortlessly can make a good day go bad and from there, to worse, for the guests. Zero sensitivity as to how to handle guests in a tough situation. No presence of mind! I have never seen a hospitality professional who is so determined to be rigid!!

However, 2 people definitely need special mentioning.
1- Abhishek Sinha, the duty manager, was truly one of the few people who made a difference. He effortlessly sorted the situation that his colleague Angad had turned worse. So, thank you Abhishek!
2 - Inderaj at the coffee shop, a team member with hearing disability, was truly exceptional with his service!

Lackluster service, truly feels like there's lack of well trained staff. The only good thing about this hotel is that the rooms were nice.

editorialSummary.text: Upscale hotel in a former palace offering plush rooms & an outdoor pool, plus fine dining options.

text.text:
We had the pleasure of celebrating our anniversary at the magnificent Jai Mahal Palace in Jaipur on 20th May 2025 and it was truly an unforgettable experience.

From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with a beautiful floral reception that set the tone for our entire stay. The warmth and hospitality extended to us throughout our visit made us feel genuinely special and completely at home.

Every member of the staff we interacted with was incredibly courteous and professional. Special thanks to the Front Office Manager and the wonderful team of ladies at the reception for their gracious assistance. We would also like to express our appreciation to Mr. Vikram, Mr. Aslam, and Chef Pradeep Thakur from the restaurant team — each one of them contributed to making our dining experience truly exceptional. The food was simply beyond our expectations — delicious, thoughtfully prepared, and served with great care.

We were also grateful for the flexibility shown with our early check-in and late check-out, which added to our comfort and convenience.

A heartfelt thank you to Mr. Rathore, the General Manager, for his thoughtful letter and warm anniversary wishes. It added a very personal touch to our stay.

It’s clear that the impeccable hospitality we experienced is a reflection of the Taj culture — one that prioritizes warmth, care, and excellence in every detail.

God bless you all, and thank you once again for making our anniversary so memorable.

Thank you
Pradeep Batra
Monica Batra

text.text: Our first Oberoi’s Rajvilas experience was absolutely amazing. A stunning property with an extraordinary staff that is so focused on serving and while a few touched us deeply, one can see the same amount of explicit passion across all. We were completely mesmerised by the property and especially those peacocks plus the other birds who were not shy to come make friends with us for a little bit of knick knack!!! Oberoi’s is known for its personalised experience and we felt it first hand yet again!!! A special mention of Harshita, a passionate intern - you have a long way to go Harshita, all the best; Golu - who we want to thank for an interestingly humorous conversation and mocktail tasting; Virendra- thanks so much for making the experience so special for our twin daughters, Priyanshu loved your courteousness and your recommendations for breakfast and last but not the least to Triambika for the most sumptuous Rajasthani cuisine experience. Your smile can make anyone’s day!!! Loved it all!!!

text.text:
I am writing the honest review:-

Disappointing Hotel Stay
Our recent stay at the hotel was extremely disappointing. The actual experience fell short of the promised image and information. Here are some issues we faced:

1. *Unhygienic conditions*: The washroom lacked basic amenities like a bucket.
2. *Poor ventilation*: The exhaust system was inadequate.
3. *Cramped room*: The room space was insufficient.
4. *Lack of service*: Staff didn't clear dirty plates.

Overpriced
Considering the poor service and amenities, the rates were unjustifiably high. We wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, especially given the expensive tariffs.

Advice
Based on our experience, we'd advise potential guests to explore alternative options that offer better value for money.

Amazing Stay at Clarks Inn Suites!
I had a wonderful experience staying at Clarks Inn Suites. From check-in to check-out, everything was smooth and pleasant. A special thanks to Mr. Ajay Nayak for assisting us during check-in, and to Lakshman, Vikas, and Punit for their exceptional hospitality throughout our stay.

Hygiene is always my top priority when choosing a hotel, and this property exceeded my expectations. The cleanliness and attention to hygiene were remarkable — spotless bedsheets and pillows, and a very clean, well-maintained washroom.

Highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a comfortable, clean, and well-managed stay!

text.text: The hotel is decent if you’re just looking for a place to rest during transit, but not ideal for exploring Jaipur — it’s located quite far from the main city attractions. The rooms are big and spacious, which is a plus, and they do offer good parking and a swimming pool. However, food is just average, and they do not serve non-vegetarian dishes or alcohol. There’s not much to see or do around the hotel either, and outside food is not allowed, which can be inconvenient. Overall, suitable for a short stay or stopover, but not recommended if you plan to experience Jaipur properly.

editorialSummary.text: Sophisticated rooms in an elegant hotel with a restaurant, a 24-hour coffee shop & a rooftop pool.

text.text:
We stayed in two rooms for two nights. The hotel has a clean, welcoming lobby and courteous reception staff, which made for a good first impression.
However, the housekeeping was a major letdown. While the rooms were clean on arrival, no bathroom towels were provided on either day in both rooms. The towels we eventually received were old and in need of replacement. On the second day, beds were made, but the floors and toilets were not cleaned at all — very disappointing.
Breakfast was equally underwhelming. The food was lukewarm, the variety minimal, and overall cleanliness in the dining area was poor. On the second morning, there were no chefs present at 7:45 AM to make omelettes, despite that being a listed service.
The hotel’s location on main Tonk Road is definitely a plus, but significant improvements in cleanliness, towel quality, and breakfast service are needed to deliver a truly comfortable stay.

text.text:
During my recent stay at [Hotel Name], I had a comfortable experience overall. The room was spacious, well-maintained, and equipped with modern amenities like a flat-screen TV, a minibar, and a cozy seating area. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a restful night's sleep. The bathroom was clean, featuring complimentary toiletries and a powerful shower. Additionally, the housekeeping staff did a great job maintaining cleanliness throughout my stay.

One of the highlights of my visit was the food. The in-room dining service was prompt, and the menu had a variety of dishes to choose from. I particularly enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which included a wide range of continental and local delicacies. The quality of the food was excellent, with fresh ingredients and flavorful preparations. The presentation was also impressive.

However, the food-lugging service could be improved. On one occasion, my meal took longer than expected to arrive, and the dish was slightly colder than preferred. While the staff was courteous and apologized for the delay, a quicker service would enhance the overall experience.

Despite this minor issue, my stay was enjoyable. The hotel's ambiance, courteous staff, and delicious food make it a great choice for both leisure and business travelers. I would definitely consider returning in the future.

One of the highlights of my visit was the food. The in-room dining service was prompt, and the menu had a variety of dishes to choose from. I particularly enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which included a wide range of continental and local delicacies. The quality of the food was excellent, with fresh ingredients and flavorful preparations. The presentation was also impressive.

However, the food-lugging service could be improved. On one occasion, my meal took longer than expected to arrive, and the dish was slightly colder than preferred. While the staff was courteous and apologized for the delay, a quicker service would enhance the overall experience.

Despite this minor issue, my stay was enjoyable. The hotel's ambiance, courteous staff, and delicious food make it a great choice for both leisure and business travelers. I would definitely consider returning in the future.

text.text:
I had a very unpleasant experience at this hotel. When we checked in, we found used wet towels both in the bathroom and on the bed,completely unacceptable hygiene standards. To make matters worse, the bed had bed bugs, which made our first night extremely uncomfortable.
We immediately reported the issue and requested the room to be cleaned. While the staff did respond, the bathroom still had a persistent foul smell, and shockingly, the bed bugs were still present even after the so called cleaning.
This level of cleanliness and carelessness is not what any guest should have to deal with. I would not recommend this hotel and would strongly advise management to seriously improve their hygiene standards.

Highly recommended for a comfortable and hassle-free stay.

text.text:
We traveled with friends and family in one of the busiest weekend of the year. There were several plus and minus we came across.

Staff was courteous. Food was good. Breakfast spread was sufficient but but expansive and variety over the days was missing.

It have several Halls of different sizes. So if you are throwing party or organizing an event, this property should be on on top of your radar given its location, ample parking catering.

If you are staying it's a different story. Penthouse floor has several rooms under renovation. The floor feels old and dusty. Smells dingy and doesn't seem to be occupied in a regular basis. Floors below are rather better served. Room service has lot of room of improvement specially with the response time. In room dining also takes forever.

Overall it's costly for its listed price, but if you get a good deal, go for it without even a second thought.

text.text:
Staff Cooperation:
The staff at Hotel Clerks Amer is highly professional and cooperative. From front desk personnel to housekeeping, the team handles guest interactions with politeness and promptness. Their willingness to assist and resolve queries efficiently is commendable and adds positively to the hotel's service standards.

Responsiveness:
Requests are addressed in a timely manner, whether it involves room-related services, general inquiries, or housekeeping needs. The staff consistently maintains a helpful attitude, creating a smooth experience for guests.

Cleanliness and Hygiene – Toiletry Areas:
While general housekeeping is acceptable, more attention is needed in the toiletry areas, particularly the urinals in the public/common restrooms. These areas require more frequent cleaning and proper maintenance to avoid unpleasant odors and visible stains. Improved hygiene in these spots would significantly uplift the overall cleanliness of the hotel.

Maintenance in Restroom Facilities:
Some restroom fittings appear slightly worn and would benefit from routine inspection and upkeep. This includes proper disinfection, deodorizing, and ensuring all plumbing fixtures function optimally.

Conclusion:

Hotel Clerks Amer benefits from a well-trained and cooperative staff, but there is a clear need to enhance hygiene standards in toiletry areas, especially around urinals in public restrooms. Addressing these concerns will improve guest comfort and reinforce a more professional standard of cleanliness.

text.text:
I recently attended a friend’s wedding at Hotel Clarks Amer in Jaipur and had a great experience overall. The property is impressive and offers a perfect blend of heritage charm and modern comforts. The rooms were really good — spacious, clean, and well-maintained, with all the necessary amenities provided. The decor had a touch of traditional Rajasthani elegance, which added to the overall vibe of the stay.

One of the highlights for me was the poolside area. It was beautifully done and served as a great spot for some of the wedding events. The open-air ambiance, ambient lighting, and ample space made it ideal for hosting gatherings. It added a relaxed, luxurious feel to the celebrations.

The hotel staff was polite and professional, and the service throughout the stay was prompt. From room service to event coordination, everything was handled smoothly. The in-house catering during the wedding was also quite impressive — the variety and taste of the food stood out, especially the local Rajasthani dishes.

The overall atmosphere at Clarks Amer is lively yet relaxing, making it a great venue for both weddings and leisure stays. Its location is convenient too, not far from the airport and city attractions. Would definitely recommend it for anyone planning an event or simply visiting Jaipur.

text.text:
My boyfriend and I enjoyed the stay a lot. Rooms were clean, modern  and specious.
Breakfast time was busy for the restaurant, but food choice and service were very good.
We enjoyed the pool, even though pigeons that live everywhere around the city does not make it easy for the hotelier to clean the rooftop area.
Dinner ordered to the room was tasty and beer at the bar refreshing. Till 6 pm you can enjoy happy hour 2 for 1. Also, we have been pleased with the laundry service and hotel staff overall.
My unique advice is to ask for the room from the south side so street noise might be less heard.

Stayed therefor a short trip, and honestly, it delivered pretty well. The location is super convenient!! Close to major markets and the railway station, which saved a lot of time.

Rooms were clean, modern, and spacious, with everything you'd expect. No complaints there. The rooftop pool and bar area were surprisingly peaceful. Not too crowded and a great spot to unwind.

Breakfast was decent, good Indian variety, but continental lovers might find it a bit limited. Also, restaurant service was a tad slow during peak hours, but the staff were polite and doing their best.

Not ultra luxury, but a solid, reliable place with professional service and good value for the price. I’d pick it again for a comfortable city stay without fuss.

text.text:
I have stayed at multiple locations of Novotel and it’s a delightful experience every time!
Stayed at the Jaipur location this time which is very conveniently located towards the outskirts of the city and easily accessible from the Mumbai expressway.
The rooms were very spacious and the bathrooms were pretty big as well. One of the areas we absolutely loved was the pool area, which is very relaxing and complete with a seating space and a separate area for lounge chairs.
The service was absolutely impeccable! We were very well taken care of, and the staff was always around to ask us if we needed anything or make changes to accommodate all the guests. One thing that can be improved though is their buffet menu, which I felt was lacking variety. The breakfast buffet was nice, with ample choices of vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. The lunch buffet, however, could be improved.
Overall, we had a nice stay and would definitely recommend it to friends and family!

text.text:
I had booking for 2 days via booking.com for 3k. As I was staying for 1 day and 4 hours above the checkout time i asked if the booking can be modified to 1.5 days. The receptionist asked 1700 for 1st day and 850 for 0.5 day which is way more. I overheard the receptionist mentioning 2250 for 1.5 day for some other tourist.
I mean why the discrimination?
The room was very small, stinky, damp, bathroom was smelly. Bed and linens were only thing acceptable.
Reception was rude. Food was tasty and hygienic and location is a good point.

But due to this incident and the other negatives compelled me to give one star coz many better options are there of the same price. One is balaji seven hills resort.

As we entered the room and started unpacking our things, we noticed many condoms on the sofa in our suite. Had the room been cleaned properly, such things wouldn't have been lying here and there in the room.
The wiping and drainage system in the bathroom was pathetic. The floor was always wet whenever you stepped on it. No mops or wipers were provided despite numerous requests.
The food ordered was stale with very less quantity and heavily overpriced.
Room service was quite slow.
The hotel calls itself as five star but is no where near 2 or 3 star.

I found this hotel when I was looking for a hotel that has a room heater after I checked out from the previous hotel that didn't provide it.

The location was great, in a busy touristy area. I didn't pay much attention nor that I cared that much but it was an old heritage hotel. The room was ok. Excellent service from male receptionist and housekeeping staff.

If you come to Rajasthan during winter you should consider booking a hotel that facilitates room heaters otherwise it won't be pleasant.

text.text:
Rooms, services and location (center of city and near all tourist places) all are excellent. Very helpful staff. I had a pleasant stay. The helpful staff and service was only because I paid a unreasonably high amount.

But they overcharged. I paid Rs 3000 for 2 rooms for many days. But even the online vendors offer the rooms at lesser amount. And I went to him offline directly. But they actually billed more than real prices. This is just wrong. I later also found cheaper rooms empty in the same hotel but they refused to give me those.

I had old parents with me and I could not put them through much movement. So I continued. But as I found out the real prices and the empty available rooms I realised they completely took advantage of me. They did not even get me room with windows when I waited for days and those rooms were available but they kept saying they are booked even after paying this hefty sum.

You should avoid this hotel as an Indian because you cannot compete with the unreasonable amounts foreigners can pay. This hotel has 90% foreign travellers. If you still need to stay, you should not pay more than Rs 2000 for this property. This I am quoting when online portals even give this hotel at Rs 1600 for deluxe rooms. And from my own extensive travel experience in Rajasthan and India regularly.

I wanted to give this hotel 5 stars but this experience left me feeling cheated very badly.

And do not approach them for any cab service or any shopping help. They will point you to contacts that give them commision and hence those cabs or shops or services loot you.

text.text:
A comfortable and pleasant stay with great value for money. The rooms are clean, spacious, and well-equipped with a digital locker and mini bar, ensuring convenience and security.

The breakfast and dinner buffets were excellent, offering a good variety of fresh and flavorful dishes. The dining area was clean and well-managed.

Staff members were polite, helpful, and attentive, which added to the overall positive experience. The hotel’s location is convenient yet peaceful, making it ideal for both business and leisure stays.

text.text:
I had a wonderful experience at Lords Hotel, largely due to the exceptional customer service provided by Fardeen. He went above and beyond to ensure my stay was comfortable, and his attentiveness truly stood out. The entire staff was very well-mannered and attentive, but Fardeen's service was a highlight that made my experience even more memorable.

Additionally, Mannish's assistance with check-out was very smooth and efficient, which I appreciated.

Upon arrival, the room was set up near the front for a better viewing experience, which was a nice touch. However, the traffic noise was quite loud and unbearable. I requested a room change to something quieter, and the staff, without hesitation, accommodated me, which I greatly appreciated.

The room was fairly clean, though there is some room for improvement. The bathroom needs maintenance, as the tap sprays water and there is some mildew build-up, which is not ideal. Despite these minor issues, the excellent hospitality, especially Fardeen’s outstanding service, made up for it.

Overall, with a cleaner bathroom and perhaps the addition of double-glazed windows to reduce traffic noise, this hotel would be even better

text.text:
There is miscommunication between 2 duty managers .
Yesterday, one duty manager allowed me to check out in 2pm.
But when I am asked the duty manager , he denies me to Chekout.

I know the checkout time is 11 a.m. , but it is clearly mentioned in the booking compliment 2 hour lake Checkout possible.  So I request them to allow me to till 2 as my train is at 3pm.

If your policy doesn't allow such thing , they you should not be mentioned in booking copies or 2 duty manager should be aware of each other communication.

Secondly, yesterday they were not serviced my room .
I request in the lobby to service my room when I am available.  I waited 2.45 to 4.30 . But no one came .

One person at 4.30 came to the room and told me sorry , we are confused whether anyone cleaned your room or not .

Really pathetic service and very miscommunication between duty managers . Rooms and locations were good and price worthy. But expected some good service at lords property.

Room number - 410
Staying date - 24/07/25 - 27/07/25
Booking id - NH23217418879204

text.text:
It was my one night stay at Hotel Lakhdatar, and definitely it was so cool. Staff was so kind and supportive, well behaved, great hosting and very cooperative. They helped me to take my luggage at thr room. Room was clean, room accessories was impressive. Towel and hand soap was availbale. Room was specious, having double bed with sofa bed and centre table also. There was a balcony also with room and it was a roadside view. At Morning break fast was served, it was Poha, Butter toast with jam and coffee, taste was good and quality with quantity was satisfactory. One more thing i will like to mention that I ordered a water bottle seperayely and during check out I asked for its payment but they didn't charged money for the water bottle. Really i was soo impressed with the staff specially who was seating at the reception. I will strongly recommend to book this property everyone, it is close to the Jaipur railway station ( Approax 300-500  Meter) and I will like to come back for sure in my next trip. I bookef thhis property with Cleartrip at Rs 1320/- with break fast.
Thank cleartrip and Thanks All Staff at Hotel Lakhdatar Palace.

text.text:
My stay at Jaipur Inn was one of the most memorable experiences I've had during my solo travels. The space was inviting, and the family that runs it was incredibly warm, helpful, friendly, and generous. I was around for almost two weeks and stayed in the lovely Treetop Room which was spacious, clean, and tucked away in just the right corner of the property.

I was so glad to have chosen this place because it felt a lot less like a hotel and a lot more like staying with extended family. The food was simple, healthy and homely. The owner, Mr. Pushpendra, offered to take the guests on the most interesting, fun and offbeat morning walks which always ended with a belly full of some of Jaipur’s best breakfast foods.

During one of the morning walks, I even found myself at Govind Dev Ji's temple (which I probably wouldn't have visited otherwise, not being a particularly religious person), and ended up really enjoying the experience. On these walks, I also explored Smriti Van, Amber Fort, a couple of other temples, and wandered through the fascinating 'rastas' of old Jaipur in search of kachoris, dhoklas, barfis - and basically, all things great.

Jaipur Inn isn’t just a place to stay- it’s a way to experience Jaipur. You’ll see the city through the eyes of those who truly adore it. If you’re looking for an authentic, heartwarming, and joy-filled experience, this is that place. I went looking for a room, and found a second home and I am so grateful for it!

text.text:
My visit to Jaipur Inn: Home away from Home with Exceptional Hospitality

Jaipur Inn is a hidden gem in the heart of Jaipur, offering a unique blend of charm and personalized service. The hotel features 30 well-appointed rooms, each with its own private balcony or sit-out area, creating a serene space to unwind after exploring the vibrant Pink City. The ambiance effortlessly blends modern comforts with traditional design, making every stay memorable.

The hotel’s rooftop restaurant (only pre-book facilities) stands out, offering panoramic views of the Jaipur skyline alongside a menu of delectable local and international cuisine. For those seeking more of relaxing dining experience, Cafe Jai on the premises offers a cozy atmosphere, ideal for enjoying coffee or light snacks.

What truly makes Jaipur Inn special is the passion and warmth of its host, Pushpendra Bhargava. A gifted storyteller and responsible citizen, Pushpendra's personal involvement ensures each guest enjoys a tailored and enriching experience. His enthusiasm for the hotel and love for Jaipur are incredible, making every visitor feel like family.

In addition to its excellent facilities, Jaipur Inn also celebrates various festivals such as Holi, Diwali, and Sakranti, adding cultural richness to your stay, please inform the hotel in advance if you want to be part of any festival s. The hotel can arrange unique activities like sunrise walks, henna painting, sessions with palmists, and yoga classes upon request, ensuring guests experience both relaxation and local traditions.

Conveniently located, Jaipur Inn provides easy access to the city’s key attractions while offering a peaceful retreat from the busy streets. Whether you're a solo traveler, couple, or family, Jaipur Inn offers a perfect combination of comfort, local culture, and personalized hospitality.

Highly recommended for those seeking an authentic and memorable stay in Jaipur.

text.text:
I am a frequent traveller and recently had a stay at Jaipur Inn. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted by a serene atmosphere that offered a perfect blend of tranquility and homeliness. The owner, whose warm hospitality was truly remarkable. He provides me eye-catch home tour and gifted me a hand made scarf.

One of the highlights of my experience was the self-service food option, which allowed me to indulge in delicious meals at my convenience. Dining space is filled with multiple vintage collection and memories.
The hotel's indoor and outdoor games provided endless entertainment for all age group. They also provide a quiet reading area. I particularly enjoyed spending time in the photogenic garden space, which was meticulously maintained and provided a picturesque backdrop for relaxation and leisurely strolls.

Overall, my stay at this hotel was nothing short of exceptional. With its serene ambiance, welcoming owner, delectable self-service food, immaculate rooms, and array of entertainment options, it's undoubtedly a hidden gem that I can't wait to revisit.

highlightedText.text: "We stayed in the Inter-Continental Jaipur for 4 nights."

text.text:
We stayed in the Inter-Continental Jaipur for 4 nights.
The hotel is modern and comfortable. Our room was   nice with the beautiful terrase, looking the swimming  pool. Everything was clean. We had the half-board terms. The dinner is served in the same restaurant as the breakfast. I think that almost for every european visitor is not easy to adapt indian gastronomic habbits.  Indians are mainly vegetarians and tend to eat very spicy food. But the personal of the restaurant, directed by maitre d`hotel Mr.Rasheb (?) have done everything to help us and make our stay pleasant.
The only problem of this hotel is the situation. It takes almost 1 hour to get to the center of the city , famous  Pink Town. It makes very difficult for the tourists to visit the city, and to be back to the hotel , because mainly europeans don`t have internet in India to call Uber, and there are almost no free taxis in the center of Jaipur.

text.text:
I recently stayed at this hotel and overall had a fairly pleasant experience, with a few areas that could use improvement. Here’s my breakdown:

Pros:

Cozy & Clean Rooms: The room was well-maintained — clean, comfortable, and just the right size for a relaxing stay.

Smooth Check-In: Despite arriving well before the official check-in time, the onboarding process was seamless and hassle-free, which was a big plus.

Polite Staff: The staff was courteous and professional throughout our stay, which added to the overall pleasant atmosphere.

Shopper’s Paradise: The location is excellent, especially for those who love to shop. There are plenty of shopping outlets and local markets nearby.

Valet Parking Available: The hotel offers valet parking service, which adds a nice touch of convenience for guests with vehicles.

Café Viva: The café at the hotel (Café Viva) serves good quality food at competitive prices, making meals convenient and enjoyable without breaking the bank.

Cons:

Housekeeping Concerns: This was the most disappointing part of the stay. After room cleaning, we had to repeatedly remind the staff for a fresh towel set, and even then, the request was only partially fulfilled. Might’ve been a one-off incident, but worth mentioning.

Parking Reality: Although valet is offered, there’s no actual hotel-owned parking space. Our car ended up being parked on the main road, which felt a bit unsafe.

Chargeable Snacks Confusion: A little clarity around the in-room snacks would have helped. While we were informed that the bar items were chargeable, the snacks left on the table came across as complimentary "welcome snacks" — only to find out at checkout that they were chargeable too.

Noise Disturbance: Some rooms are poorly soundproofed, and we experienced noticeable noise around midnight — possibly from the top-floor restro bar or somewhere outside. It wasn’t unbearable, but definitely impacted sleep quality.

Conclusion:

This hotel has quite a few positives going for it, especially in terms of comfort, location, food, and hospitality. However, attention to details like housekeeping and clearer communication would go a long way in elevating the guest experience. I wouldn’t rule out staying here again, but would hope to see some improvements next time.

Housekeeping Concerns: This was the most disappointing part of the stay. After room cleaning, we had to repeatedly remind the staff for a fresh towel set, and even then, the request was only partially fulfilled. Might’ve been a one-off incident, but worth mentioning.

Parking Reality: Although valet is offered, there’s no actual hotel-owned parking space. Our car ended up being parked on the main road, which felt a bit unsafe.

Chargeable Snacks Confusion: A little clarity around the in-room snacks would have helped. While we were informed that the bar items were chargeable, the snacks left on the table came across as complimentary "welcome snacks" — only to find out at checkout that they were chargeable too.

Noise Disturbance: Some rooms are poorly soundproofed, and we experienced noticeable noise around midnight — possibly from the top-floor restro bar or somewhere outside. It wasn’t unbearable, but definitely impacted sleep quality.

Conclusion:

This hotel has quite a few positives going for it, especially in terms of comfort, location, food, and hospitality. However, attention to details like housekeeping and clearer communication would go a long way in elevating the guest experience. I wouldn’t rule out staying here again, but would hope to see some improvements next time.

text.text:
We stayed in two rooms for two nights. The hotel has a clean, welcoming lobby and courteous reception staff, which made for a good first impression.
However, the housekeeping was a major letdown. While the rooms were clean on arrival, no bathroom towels were provided on either day in both rooms. The towels we eventually received were old and in need of replacement. On the second day, beds were made, but the floors and toilets were not cleaned at all — very disappointing.
Breakfast was equally underwhelming. The food was lukewarm, the variety minimal, and overall cleanliness in the dining area was poor. On the second morning, there were no chefs present at 7:45 AM to make omelettes, despite that being a listed service.
The hotel’s location on main Tonk Road is definitely a plus, but significant improvements in cleanliness, towel quality, and breakfast service are needed to deliver a truly comfortable stay.

We had an exceptional stay at Hotel Royal Orchid. The staff went above and beyond to ensure our comfort, always wearing warm smiles and providing helpful assistance. The spacious rooms were a delight, equipped with both a refreshing shower and a luxurious separate bathtub. We couldn't have asked for a more comfortable accommodation.

One of the highlights of our experience was the delightful culinary offerings. From breakfast to lunch and dinner, there was an extensive selection of food choices catering to all dietary needs. Whether you were a vegetarian, vegan, or had specific dietary restrictions, the hotel's dining options had you covered. The quality and variety of the meals were outstanding, leaving us spoilt for choice.

Furthermore, the hotel's location was a definite advantage. Situated conveniently close to the airport and within a reasonable distance from the main city, it allowed us easy access to both travel connections and the famous attractions of Jaipur. The lively ambiance of live music and other entertainment offered daily added an extra charm to our evenings.

Overall, our stay at Hotel Royal Orchid was nothing short of remarkable. The friendly and attentive staff, spacious and comfortable rooms, delectable dining options, and convenient location all contributed to a truly enjoyable experience. We left with fond memories and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Jaipur.

text.text:
Hotel Royal Orchid, Jaipur, is a fantastic destination that offers a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and exceptional hospitality. Located near Jaipur International Airport, this 5-star hotel is ideal for both leisure and business travelers. Here’s a detailed review:

Ambiance and Design

The hotel boasts a sophisticated and elegant design, with contemporary interiors that reflect a sense of grandeur. The lobby is spacious, welcoming, and tastefully decorated, instantly giving a luxurious feel. The hotel’s well-maintained gardens and outdoor spaces add a refreshing charm to the ambiance.

Rooms and Accommodation

The rooms at Hotel Royal Orchid are spacious, well-furnished, and equipped with modern amenities. The comfortable beds, plush linens, and stylish decor create a relaxing atmosphere. The bathrooms are clean and feature premium fittings. Many rooms offer beautiful views of the city or the pool, adding to the overall experience.

Dining

The dining options are truly exceptional. The hotel’s in-house restaurant, Limelight, serves a wide range of cuisines, including Indian, Continental, and Chinese, with high-quality ingredients and impeccable presentation. Tiger Trail, their specialty restaurant, is a must-try for lovers of authentic Indian cuisine, especially its tandoori dishes. The breakfast buffet is lavish, offering plenty of choices to start your day on a delightful note.

Facilities and Amenities

The hotel offers an array of top-notch facilities, including:
•	A rooftop swimming pool with stunning views, perfect for relaxation.
•	A fully-equipped fitness center for health-conscious guests.
•	Banquet halls and conference rooms, ideal for hosting weddings, corporate events, or private gatherings.
•	A poolside bar that adds a touch of luxury to your evenings.

The Wi-Fi connectivity is strong throughout the property, and the hotel provides concierge services to assist with local sightseeing or travel arrangements.

Service

The staff at Hotel Royal Orchid are courteous, attentive, and highly professional. From the reception to housekeeping and restaurant staff, everyone goes above and beyond to ensure a pleasant stay. Special requests are handled promptly and efficiently.

Location

The hotel’s proximity to the airport and key attractions like Jawahar Circle, City Palace, and Hawa Mahal makes it a convenient base for exploring Jaipur. Despite being close to major areas, the property maintains a peaceful and serene environment.

Overall Experience

Hotel Royal Orchid, Jaipur, is an excellent choice for a luxurious and memorable stay in the Pink City. Its combination of elegant ambiance, outstanding service, and world-class amenities make it stand out. Whether you’re in Jaipur for business, a family vacation, or a romantic getaway, this hotel will exceed your expectations.

Rating: 4.7/5
Highly recommended for anyone looking for a premium stay in Jaipur!

I recently stayed at Novotel Jaipur Convention Centre with my wife for three days, and our experience was nothing short of wonderful. From the moment we arrived until check-out, every interaction was handled with warmth, professionalism, and genuine hospitality that truly made us feel at home.

What stood out was not just the quality of the facilities, but the seamless coordination and positive attitude of the entire team. Every staff member—from valet and security, to reception, breakfast attendants, and housekeeping—treated us with attentiveness and kindness. It always felt like everyone was not just doing their job, but actually cared about making our stay comfortable.

A special mention goes to the management, especially Mr. Sunil. In our brief conversation, I was struck by the compassion he shows towards his team—asking thoughtful questions, ensuring everyone was looked after, and by extension, making guests feel genuinely valued. The team is clearly empowered and trusted, handling requests confidently and promptly, with no unnecessary delays or back-and-forths for approvals. This culture of care and ownership radiates through every aspect of the guest experience.

Our stay was truly comfortable in every way: our requests were handled smoothly, the hotel was impeccably maintained, and there was always thoughtful attention to detail. It’s rare to find a property where the service matches the infrastructure so perfectly.

All in all, we couldn’t have asked for a better vacation stay. Thanks to every team member who contributed to making our trip special. We’re already looking forward to coming back and highly recommend Novotel Jaipur to anyone seeking a genuine and memorable hospitality experience.

What stood out was not just the quality of the facilities, but the seamless coordination and positive attitude of the entire team. Every staff member—from valet and security, to reception, breakfast attendants, and housekeeping—treated us with attentiveness and kindness. It always felt like everyone was not just doing their job, but actually cared about making our stay comfortable.

A special mention goes to the management, especially Mr. Sunil. In our brief conversation, I was struck by the compassion he shows towards his team—asking thoughtful questions, ensuring everyone was looked after, and by extension, making guests feel genuinely valued. The team is clearly empowered and trusted, handling requests confidently and promptly, with no unnecessary delays or back-and-forths for approvals. This culture of care and ownership radiates through every aspect of the guest experience.

Our stay was truly comfortable in every way: our requests were handled smoothly, the hotel was impeccably maintained, and there was always thoughtful attention to detail. It’s rare to find a property where the service matches the infrastructure so perfectly.

All in all, we couldn’t have asked for a better vacation stay. Thanks to every team member who contributed to making our trip special. We’re already looking forward to coming back and highly recommend Novotel Jaipur to anyone seeking a genuine and memorable hospitality experience.

text.text: I had an excellent stay. The rooms were spacious and spotless, the staff was warm and extremely attentive, and the dining experience was truly outstanding. The hotel’s facilities, from the pool to the spa, added to the overall comfort, making it a perfect 5-star experience.

text.text:
I recently stayed for 7 days and 6 nights, and my experience surpassed any five-star hotel. The luxury and affordability were exceptional, but what truly made my stay memorable was the outstanding hospitality. The staff were incredibly kind and helpful, treating me like family.

I must commend Haad for his honesty and kindness; he informed me that the non-veg food served was halal, which allowed me to enjoy it comfortably. Saikat was also very understanding, arranging breakfast at 5 AM and ensuring we had food even if we were late. Other staff members, including Barsha, Aalok, Tushar, and Shahid, were equally kind and sweet, transforming my office trip into a relaxing vacation.

Roopesh at the reception was also excellent, offering a discount and seamlessly changing our room to a poolside view.

The only minor issue was the bathroom under the washbasin, which lacked proper slope for water drainage. However, the reception team promptly cleaned it to perfection whenever we reported it.

I also want to highlight the exceptional pool and other areas of the hotel. They were outstanding, and words cannot do them justice.

I highly recommend this place for its exceptional service and commend the staff for their dedication. Special recognition and promotion should be considered for Haad, Saikat, and the others mentioned.

text.text:
It was my business trip to Jaipur ! My suite was very comfortable with beautiful views from both the sides ..it was an unbelievable stay at Lords plaza an extremely well maintained, decor full of taste and charm ! The breakfast is one of the best I have had anywhere with many elements. The location is surprisingly good just 5 minutes away from Johari Bazaar... one of the main tourist attraction of Jaipur.

This hotel has really great charm , well trained-professional and friendly staff. There is also a car park which is very useful as there are many hotel's who have parking crunch. What a Fantastic place , I will come back because of the service alone.

Highly recommended.

Check Price Online or call directly .. I hope they offer you the best .

Note:

1. All Hotel's Supply Hard water , take care of your hair.

2.  Try to Hire Rental base cars or bike's as Auto Fare is too high for Tourists.

3. Try not to buy thing's from tourist area as they sell duplicate products.

4. If you are buying Ker-Sangri famous desert Vegetables make sure to buy good one that will cost you between 30 to 40 Rs for 250 gm.

5. All famous shops in Jaipur for food are Hype , buy from Non-Famous shops their taste are also too good for snacks.

6. Amer Fort entry fees is 100 Rs / - DSLR SHOOTING IS ALLOWED WITHOUT CHARGES.

text.text:
Our stay at this hotel was nothing short of exceptional. The room was spacious, elegantly designed, and meticulously clean, offering all the comforts we needed for a relaxing getaway. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the view from our window was absolutely stunning, making waking up each morning a delight.

What truly set this hotel apart was the incredible dining experience. The on-site restaurant served some of the best food we’ve ever had, with a menu that showcased both local and international flavors. Each meal was a culinary masterpiece, from the delicious breakfast spread to the exquisite dinner options. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend a perfect pairing or special dish.

Having such amazing food just steps away from our room made our stay even more memorable. The combination of luxurious accommodations and world-class dining created the perfect balance of comfort and indulgence. Whether you’re here for relaxation, exploration, or simply to enjoy great food, this hotel offers an experience that’s second to none. We can’t wait to return!

text.text:
Lords plaza Jaipur sets a benchmark for hospitality in this industry. We absolutely loved our stay here. This was the best place to stay in order to explore Jaipur. It was far more than value for money in my opinion. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone staying in Jaipur for Business or Vacation!

Room & Premises:
The 5th floor Pavillion room was where we stayed and it was exquisite! The room was pretty spacious. It has a small protruding and curved sitting area with floor to ceiling glass and view to admire, comfortable enough for the two of us and we did spend a lot of time there peeking out at the views. We could spot Birla temple, Moti doongri fort, the tip of Albert hall museum and some mountains right from there. The traffic signal below kept us entertained as well. We were provided with everything you would need in the room, fresh towels, toiletries, bath mat, tea/coffee cart with hot water kettle, mini refrigerator, working tv with all the channels, sufficient luggage racks and office desk. The bathroom was separated from the room with a glass barrier(with a curtain for optional privacy), it looked amazing! Even though the hotel is right on the main road, it was never noisy and we had a good night's sleep throughout our stay here.

Location:
I would give this place full points for location. Albert hall museum and Masala chowk food court , both of which are in Nehru park right in front of the hotel. Hawa mahal, Jantar mantar and Bapu Bazar are also walkable from here. Birla temple is also very near. Autos are available as soon as you get out since the hotel is on the main road so it was very convenient to explore the city from here. A lot of good cafes and restaurants are also nearby ( in C-scheme). It felt pretty safe since there is a traffic signal right below and it is on the main road so we could easily walk to our room at night from nehru park in the hustle bustle of traffic.

Food:
A good in-house restaurant goes such a long way in customer experience and these guys have nailed it! The coriander restaurant...so good! They had complimentary breakfast here which was such a good spread, I have rarely encountered such a variety of tasty spread elsewhere. Dinner was a chargeable buffet and ala-carte, frankly the dinner buffet was such a steal at the price that it was our preferred option every day. Food was delicious, so lip-smacking good. The service was fast as well. I highly recommend everyone to try this restaurant. They even provided us with on-the-house tea & coffee after our checkout while we waited in the restaurant for hours since we still had time to catch our train. They went out of their way to serve us and checked up on us, it melted my heart!

Hospitality & Staff:
Frankly, in terms of hospitality this was the best hotel I have encountered in my life and that is saying something especially including my travel to 5* hotels internationally. The staff is so prompt, proactive, polite and professional. It makes me feel so proud that such hospitality exists in an Indian hotel. The entrance to the hotel is so well designed, your cab would stop right in front, luggage was picked up by the door man promptly. The door man greeted us with a genuine smile every time we went in or out of the hotel. Checkin was quick to our Pavillion room, they even put our trolley bags in the room on top of the luggage racks so it was convenient for us to open, so thoughtful! Our room was cleaned every single day, the towels were replaced daily, the tea/coffee cart, toiletries replenished daily, fresh water bottles provided daily. The long chats we could easily have with the smiling and polite staff was so heartwarming. Their service was really beyond our expectations. Special mention for Mr. Beekam, and restaurant staff Shiv, Santosh and Pandey Ji who were so attentive, polite and kind to us. This place reminds me of what we used to stand for "Atithi Devo Bhavah". This is how I felt about the hospitality here, such warmth can be found only at Lords Plaza, Jaipur.

text.text:
Hotel Review: Hotel Lakhdatar, Khatu, Rajasthan

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Lakhdatar in Khatu, Rajasthan, and my experience was exceptional.

Location: The hotel's proximity to the Khatu Shyamji Temple is a significant advantage, being just a short walk away.

Cleanliness: The rooms and common areas were impeccably clean, reflecting the hotel's commitment to maintaining high hygiene standards.

Staff and Service: The staff was incredibly friendly and courteous, always ready to assist with any requests. Their warm hospitality made the stay even more enjoyable.

Amenities: The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, laundry facilities, and an on-site restaurant serving delicious food. The room was well-equipped with modern amenities, ensuring a comfortable stay.

Overall Experience: Hotel Lakhdatar exceeded my expectations for a 3-star hotel. Its excellent location, cleanliness, friendly staff, and quality services make it a top choice for travelers visiting Khatu. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to the area.
